mav_sim.chap2.transforms module¶

transforms.py implements the basic transforms from chapter 2

There are seven frames defined in chapter two:

Iniertial frame (i) - Fixed to earth Vehicle frame (v) - Parellel to (i), but fixed to uav Vehicle 1 frame (v1) - Rotate yaw (psi) about k^v Vehicle 2 frame (v2) - Rotate pitch (theta) about j^{v1} Body frame (b) - Rotate roll (phi) about i^{v2} Stability frame (s) - Rotate left hand alpha about j^b Wind frame (w) - Rotate beta about k^s

Functions:
This module contains a number of functions for calculating basic rotations

rot_x: calculate elementary rotation matrix about x-axis rot_y: calculate elementary rotation matrix about y-axis rot_z: calculate elementary rotation matrix about z-axis

This module also contains a number of functions for calculating basic rotation matrices

rot_v_to_v1: calculates the rotation from frame v to v1 rot_v1_to_v2: calculates the rotation from frame v1 to v2 rot_v2_to_b: calculates the rotation from v2 to body frame rot_b_to_s: calculates the rotation from body to stability frame rot_s_to_w: calculates the rotation from stability to wind frame rot_v_to_b: calculates the rotation from vehicle to body frame rot_b_to_v: calculates the rotation from body frame to vehicle frame

This module also computes a number of functions for calculating the transforms of points

trans_i_to_v: transforms a point from inertial frame to the vehicle frame trans_v_to_i: transforms a point from vehicle frame to the inertial frame trans_i_to_b: transforms a point from inertial frame to the body frame trans_b_to_i: transforms a point from the body frame to the inertial frame

mav_sim.chap2.transforms.rot_b_to_s(alpha: float) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

calculates the rotation from body frame to stability frame

Parameters:

alpha – left-hand rotation angle about j^b to align i^s with projection of V_a onto i^b-k^b plane

Returns:

Rotation matrix from body frame to stability frame

Return type:

rot

mav_sim.chap2.transforms.rot_b_to_v(psi: float, theta: float, phi: float) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

calculates the rotation matrix from body frame to vehicle frame

Parameters:

  • psi – yaw angle about k^v axis

  • theta – pitch angle about j^{v1} axis

  • phi – roll angle about i^{v2} axis

Returns:

Rotation matrix from body frame to vehicle frame

Return type:

rot

mav_sim.chap2.transforms.rot_s_to_w(beta: float) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

calculates the rotation from stability frame to wind frame

Parameters:

beta – rotation about k^s axis to align i^w with V_a

Returns:

Rotation matrix from body frame to stability frame

Return type:

rot

mav_sim.chap2.transforms.rot_v1_to_v2(theta: float) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

calculates the rotation from frame v1 to v2

Parameters:

theta – pitch angle about j^{v1} axis

Returns:

Rotation matrix from frame v1 to v2

Return type:

rot

mav_sim.chap2.transforms.rot_v2_to_b(phi: float) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

calculates the rotation from frame v2 to body

Parameters:

phi – roll angle about i^{v2} axis

Returns:

Rotation matrix from frame v2 to b

Return type:

rot

mav_sim.chap2.transforms.rot_v_to_b(psi: float, theta: float, phi: float) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

calculates the rotation matrix from vehicle frame to body frame

Parameters:

  • psi – yaw angle about k^v axis

  • theta – pitch angle about j^{v1} axis

  • phi – roll angle about i^{v2} axis

Returns:

Rotation matrix from vehicle frame to body frame

Return type:

rot

mav_sim.chap2.transforms.trans_b_to_i(pose: Pose, p_b: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Transforms a point from body frame to the inertial frame

Parameters:

p_b – Point represented in the body frame

Returns:

Point represented in the inertial frame

Return type:

p_i
